caseTitle: Mian Sohail Ahmed v. The State, etc
authorJudge: Mr. Justice Syed Mansoor Ali Shah
tagline: Identification of an accused is a two-step process. First, the suspect undergoes a test identification parade and second, the credibility of the eye-witness is assessed by weighing the evidence in the light of the estimator variables. A non-exhaustive list of "estimator variables" negatively affecting the memory process includes stress, weapon focus, duration, distance and lighting, characteristics of witness and perpetrator.
